meta.title: As Americans, what do we owe each other?

hero.text: As Americans, what do we owe each other?

slidesScroll.text: Our country is increasingly polarized.
As we approach America’s 250th anniversary, it is important to remember the principles that bind us together.
We asked 5,000 Americans from all 50 states: what are the responsibilities of being an American?

slidesFixed.text: What percent of Americans do you think view “supporting democracy” as a civic responsibility? ● Drag the dot to your guess. Continue scrolling to submit.
You said {userResponse}%. The correct answer is XX%.
Almost 98% of Americans see “paying your taxes” as a civic responsibility.
Less than 10% see “donating to charity” as a civic responsibility.
But more than 50% see things like “fighting for people’s rights” and “honoring the flag” as civic responsibilities.
Our responsibilities as Americans are far more complex and wide-ranging than what you might read in a Civic 101 textbook.
